title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Hi

Macbook a1279

Have changed audio board but not cables yet

No audio but if you plug in a pair of headphones sound seems fine

Any idea

Doesn't seem any corrasion but havent removed the board yet
No audio out of either speaker

Did see a note on wiki about T2

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Do you mean A2179 instead?
That one has T2, yes.
And suffers by liquid spill on audio board.
Remove the board and check it for corrosion, as the audio flex too.

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Hi sorry yes you are correct

Have changed audio board if you mean the board which has the jack socket on it

I havent changed the 2 flex cables yet

When i put replacement board in still no volume

But unsure if speakers are working

If i put headphones in can hear sound

the audio board looked clean and with just swapping it over with a replacement didnt make a difference

Will check cable

Is there any known issue on the main board of these

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message: Check diode mode to ground at pins 32 & 33 of J6100.

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Hi
Do you happen to know where the protection circuitry is on this 

As this morning i have no power 
when i plug into my usb tester is only staying at 5v not switching and not pulling any amps

I wonder if a fuse has failed

Also strange thing on the other 1 i have that works even with that audio board you talk about missing plays the start up tune

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Checking on my working unit that should be 3.2 fixed i believe
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 96230, member: 682"]
"Check diode mode to ground at pins 32 & 33 of J6100."
???
[/QUOTE]

pin 33 on diode mode(squeeler) settles at 0.17

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO
message:
Compare diode mode readings on J6100 with good board.
Very low readings on T2 data lines, may point to damaged T2.

title: MACBOOK AIR A1279 AUDIO

so a total scrapper
